thread.title: Food prices to rise after Brexit, says Devon's Green MEP | Devon Live
thread.title_full: Food prices to rise after Brexit, says Devon's Green MEP | Devon Live

title: Food prices to rise after Brexit, says Devon's Green MEP | Devon Live
text:
Food prices to rise after Brexit, says Devon's Green MEP By JoeBulmer | Posted: February 27, 2017 0 COMMENTS SHARES Comments (0) 
Green MEP Molly Scott Cato believes people will have to pay more for food after Brexit, according to an interview she gave to DevonLive. 
Molly Scott-Cato caught up with DevonLive and North Devon Journal reporter Joe Bulmer while on a tour of the South West. 
The MEP has been giving talks during the tour about two agricultural reports she commissioned looking at how the agriculture industry will fair after Brexit and what the government can do to help. 
The interview looked at a variety of subjects beside farming, including food prices, the timetable for Brexit , the role of MEPs after leaving the EU, immigration and the opportunities which come with leaving. 
Mrs Scott-Cato believes UK consumers "may have to pay more food" after Brexit and wants people and politicians to "wise up and stop being so irrational about the issue of immigration".
